SEARCH
Package org.example.server.rmi

Class RMIServerImpl

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
org.example.server.rmi.RMIServerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Remote, RMIServerInterface
public class RMIServerImpl extends UnicastRemoteObject implements RMIServerInterface
The RMIServerImpl class is an implementation of the RMIServerInterface. This class handles the RMI server-side logic, managing client connections and facilitating communication between the server and clients.

    • connect

      public String connect(String username, RMIClientCallbackInterface clientCallback) throws RemoteException
      Handles a new client connection. Adds the client to the server, manages the number of connections, and handles color selection. It's the same for the TCP
      Specified by:
      connect in interface RMIServerInterface
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the connecting client.
      clientCallback - The callback interface for communicating with the client.
      Returns:
      A message indicating the connection status.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If an RMI-related error occurs.

    • chooseColor

      public void chooseColor(String username, String color) throws RemoteException
      Handles the color selection for a client. Delegates the color selection to the server.
      Specified by:
      chooseColor in interface RMIServerInterface
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the client.
      color - The color chosen by the client.
